title: Partner Funds Program Manager
content:
Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.There is only one Data Cloud. Snowflake’s founders started from scratch and designed a data platform built for the cloud that is effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. But it didn’t stop there. They engineered Snowflake to power the Data Cloud, where thousands of organizations unlock the value of their data with near-unlimited scale, concurrency, and performance. This is our vision: a world with endless insights to tackle the challenges and opportunities of today and reveal the possibilities of tomorrow.
With the launch of the Snowflake Partner Network (SPN) program, Snowflake is working to cultivate the most capable and comprehensive ecosystem of partners to support our customers on their journey to the data cloud. 
The Snowflake Partner Funds team is actively seeking a talented and energetic Program Manager to help us develop and grow the incentive programs for partners.  We are looking for someone with a deep passion for customers and partners with a desire to influence geographic performance through some of Snowflake’s most significant investments. The right individual will be able to work cross group through thought leadership, take end-to-end ownership of driving program strategy and execution, which includes the ability to execute with excellence, work with ambiguity, have an analytical mindset, collaborate well with cross-functional teams, and have strong internal and external executive-level of communication skills. 
Success in the position requires the candidate to understand how incentives influences the pipeline, establish cross-functional alignment, set program goals and metrics, and track progress. The candidate will also be required to work across alliances, sales, operations, finance, and other groups to ensure successful adoption of the program. In addition, the candidate will also be required to pull data across multiple dashboards and data sets, to build the return-on-investment and impact driven by the incentive programs.
We are seeking a candidate with a proven track record of strong communication skills, diplomacy in building consensus, and strong business acumen in designing and rolling out partner funds programs. 
AS A PARTNER FUNDS PROGRAM MANAGER AT SNOWFLAKE YOU WILL BE ACCOUNTABLE FOR:

Develop program models and operational support to drive and accelerate Snowflake Partners
Identify strategies, designs, governance, and policy structures to accelerate sales and revenue with partner incentives
Develop financial model(s) that identify the impact of fund programs
Identify infrastructure to support business requirements with current and new programs
Develop launch plan and timeline to implement and launch program enhancements
Create customer, partner, and sales team program documentation to clearly identify the terms and conditions, rules of engagement, benefits, and marketing collateral 
Manage and collaborate with sales, marketing, and GEO for feedback on the programs to drive future enhancements to accelerate return-on-investments
Build out a 12-18-month plan of program roadmap and enhancements which will define the company’s future

OUR IDEAL PARTNER FUNDS MANAGER WILL HAVE:

4+ years in experience managing Partner Programs, Partner Incentives and Investments, Channel Sales/Marketing management 
BS/BA degree in a related field required
Ability to self-start and self-manage work in a fast-paced environment
Intermediate skill level in data analysis and use of Excel and PowerPoint
Strong business and financial acumen
Strong skills in multi-tasking, communications, negotiation, organization, and teamwork
Proven self-starter with a high degree of initiative
Demonstrated success in project management and process analysis
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong problem-solving skills and ability to organize priorities in a dynamic environment
Ability to travel 20% of the time

Snowflake is growing fast, and we are scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.

questions.label: Where have you most recently worked?
Have you worked at Snowflake in the past in a Full-time, Part-time, contractor or Intern capacity?
For Snowflake to anticipate possible immigration timelines and obligations, could you confirm you are currently authorized to work in the country to which you are applying?

Will you require sponsorship to continue or extend your current work authorization status, either now or in the future (Example – including but not limited to: work permits such as H-1B in the United States, Highly Skilled Migrant in the Netherlands or a Blue Card in Poland or Germany. This could also include change of sponsorship from your current employer to Snowflake)?
A “U.S. person” is a citizen, legal permanent resident, or legal temporary resident (i.e., a refugee or asylee) of the United States. Which of the following best describes your “U.S. person” status?

values.label: I am a citizen of Cuba, Iran, North Korea, or Syria AND I am NOT a U.S. person.
None of the above; I am a citizen of a different country.

questions.label: [US Applicants Only] Are you subject to any post-employment restrictions based on your role as a government (federal, state, local, or otherwise) employee or contractor, including representational restrictions or restrictions arising from work on a government procurement?
Due to SEC auditor independence requirements, please let us know whether you have previously worked at, or if currently working at PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC), who is our independent auditor.

values.label: Yes - I have previously worked at, or is currently working at PwC.
No - I have never been employed by PwC.

questions.description: When you apply to a job on this site, the personal data contained in your application will be collected by Snowflake. Your personal data will be processed for the purposes of managing Snowflake’s recruitment related activities, which include setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing the results thereto, and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment and hiring processes. Such processing is legally permissible under Art. 6(1)(f) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (General Data Protection Regulation) as necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by Snowflake, which are the solicitation, evaluation, and selection of applicants for employment. Snowflake will share your personal data with Greenhouse Software, Inc., a cloud services provider located in the United States of America and engaged by Snowflake to help manage its recruitment and hiring process on Snowflake’s behalf. Accordingly, if you are located outside of the United States, your personal data will be transferred to the United States once you submit it through this site and such transfer will be subject to appropriate safeguards under standard contractual clauses as approved by the European Union Commission and/or the Privacy Shield framework. Further information about how Snowflake processes your personal data can be found in our Privacy Notice (the term “privacy notice” to be a link to our privacy notice located at https://www.snowflake.com/privacy-policy/ ). Your personal data will be retained by Snowflake as long as we determine it is necessary to evaluate your application for employment. You have the right to data portability, to request access to your personal data, to request that your personal data be rectified or erased, and to request that processing of your personal data be restricted. Such requests can be made by contacting us at privacy@snowflake.com.
questions.label: Point of Data Transfer
